There are $n$ cities located along a one-way road. Each city has a certain number of goods produced ($p_i$) and a limit on how many goods can be sold ($s_i$). You can transport goods between cities, but:

* You can only transport goods from a city with a lower index to a city with a higher index.
* You can transport at most $c$ goods in a single transportation.

What is the maximum total number of goods that can be sold in all the cities after transporting goods between them?

You have a number of cities connected by a one-way road. Each city produces a certain amount of goods and has a limit on how many goods it can sell. You can transport goods between cities, but only from a city with a lower index to one with a higher index, and you can only transport a maximum of a certain amount per trip.  What is the maximum total number of goods that can be sold across all cities after transporting goods?
